message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $12,000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll find it valuable. Let me know what you think!
Hello Alice, thank you for your offer. I understand the value of your product, but I am only willing to pay up to $9,000 for it. I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. While $9,000 is a step in the right direction, I'm still unable to go that low.  I'm willing to meet you halfway at $10,500. This reflects both the value of the product and our desire to reach an agreement. What do you say?
Hello Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I still feel that $9,000 would be a fair price for the product. I believe we can reach an agreement at this point. Thank you for considering my position.

Bob, I understand your perspective, but $9,000 simply doesn't work for me.  I'm willing to come down to $10,000, which is a significant concession. This is my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to explore other options.  Time is of the essence.
Hello Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I still feel that $9,000 would be a fair price for the product. I believe we can reach an agreement at this point. Thank you for considering my position.
